section.title: Shadow Facts
section.para: A shadow fact is a shallow copy of an asserted object. Shadow facts are cached version of a given object asserted to the working memory. The term shadow facts is common known as a feature of JESS (Java Expert System Shell). The origins of shadow facts trace back to Truth maintenance concepts. A running system may alter a fact during evaluation. When this occurs, the rule engine must know a modification occurred and handle the change appropriately. One way to handle changes in an orderly fashion is to cache a shallow copy of an object. As of Drools 3.0, shadow facts hasn't been implemented, but it is planned for the future.
